## Ramea Island Helicopter Pad Replacement Tender

**Title:** Ramea Island Helicopter Pad Replacement

**Reference Number:** 30005776

**Statutory Requirements:** Invitation to Qualify - Competitive - Open bidding

**Description:**

The proposed project involves the construction of a helicopter landing pad located at North West Head Light Station in Ramea, Newfoundland and Labrador. The proposed project will include the removal of existing helicopter landing pad wooden timbers only, concrete to remain, and the installation of a new helicopter pad in a new location.

**Scope of Work:**

The scope of work includes:

* Demolition of existing wooden timbers
* Minor excavation works to facilitate placement of new concrete foundations
* Installation of a new helicopter pad using treated timber, concrete, and metal safety netting
* Replacement of the existing helicopter pad in the new location

**Contact Information:**

* Contracting Entity: Fisheries and Oceans Canada
* Name: Lana Hunt
* Email: lana.hunt@dfo-mpo.gc.ca
* Phone: (604) 315-0314
* Notice URL: None

**Attachments:**

* Request for Qualification (RFQ) document
* Addendum 001

**Submission Guidelines:**

* All queries should be submitted in writing to the Contracting Authority no later than seven (7) calendar days before the bid closing date.
* The Contractor must perform and complete the work by November 30, 2024.

**Eligibility:**

* Prospective bidders must meet the eligibility criteria outlined in the RFQ document.
* The Contractor must have the necessary qualifications, experience, and resources to complete the project.

**Important Dates:**

* Tender Closing Date: July 11, 2024 at 2:00 PM (Canada Eastern Time)
* Expected Contract Start Date: August 23, 2024
* Expected Contract End Date: November 30, 2024

**Additional Information:**

* The Contracting Authority reserves the right to reject any or all bids.
* The Contractor must comply with all applicable laws and regulations, including but not limited to, the Canada Labour Code, the Occupational Health and Safety Regulations, and the Environmental Protection Act.

**Purchase Orders:**

* A purchase order will be issued to the successful bidder.
* The Contracting Authority will provide a contract notice after awarding the contract.

**Expenditure Estimates:**

* The estimated value of this project is not available.
